alert.note: Alert for Burke; Columbia; Lincoln; McDuffie; Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lake Wind Advisory issued March 11 at 4:02AM EST until March 12 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...LAKE WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 10 PM EST SATURDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Lake Wind Advisory, west winds 10 to 20 knots with gusts up to 30 knots expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 23 possible. * WHERE...All of central South Carolina and east central Georgia. * WHEN...For the Lake Wind Advisory, from 1 AM to 10 PM EST Saturday. For the Freeze Watch, from Saturday evening through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Strong winds and rough waves on area lakes will create hazardous conditions for small craft. Freezing conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Boaters on area lakes should use extra caution since strong winds and rough waves can overturn small craft. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
